Summary: When we arrived there was someone digging through the garbage bins.  The room was unacceptable. The bathroom was covered in a layer of dust. When you looked at the lights they were coated in dust and dirt. Only one bulb worked in the bathroom. There was a lot of dirt and hair behind the door like it hadn't been vacuumed or swept in weeks. The bathroom floor was actually dirty. The rack that held the towels was completely orange from rust. There was hair in the bed sheets. We didn't feel clean or safe. The 24 hour front desk is standing outside and ringing a bell. Stay somewhere else.

We stayed here for three nights while visiting the very nearby Disneyland. Little Boy Blue doesn't have fancy extras or facilities but it does have a spacious and well laid out room, free parking, a comfortable bed and a good night's rest. 15 minutes walk took us to the gates of Disneyland and 5 minutes took us to very nice eateries at Anaheim Garden Walk.  The room is dated, for sure, but we spent almost no time in it.  Our belongings were secure, the room was clean and we were well rested.  The only thing I miss, and this is so minor, is a coffee facility in the room. There is a microwave, which is no doubt very useful to some, and a very useful fridge/freezer. However, this is so minor and a regular thing with motels (I gather).  I just missed a coffee at 7am.  There is a

This family run hotel is only a 10 minute walk from Disneyland Resort and reasonably priced.  You can tell that the rooms were recently remodeled and new furniture put in. Great value for the price and You can park aftercheckout for $10.

we stayed for 4 nights, on a visit to Disneyland.  the front desk checked us in early.  the room was clean, comfortable beds, ac worked great.  Fridge and microwave.  lots of restrauants nearby.  easy walking to Disney. would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great location, fantastic staff and clean room
Summary: My sons and I stayed here in October this year, and found it to be a little gem.  We were first attracted to this property due to its price and location.  Once we got there, we realised that the location was fantastic, there is a great pizza shop around 100 metres away as well as a CVS and Walgreens super close for snacks etc.  Disneyland is only 500ish  metres away.  The room was a bit dark but it was really hot so made it cool.  The microwave and fridge was a bonus and it had a large table to sit at for meals.  The AC was effective and kept us cool.  We were able to get early checkin and the manager most accommodating.  I didnt expect the Hilton but I didnt pay Hilton prices either, I have stayed in worse for more money.  For the location it self it was the best selling point.

This is probably the worst motel I have ever stayed in. The reception is grubby the only member of staff, unfriendly. The room was dark, dirty and sticky. As I walked through the door my son stood on a safety pin which was embedded in the carpet. The carpet was stinking. The bathroom was stinking and each towel came with a lovely black hair in every fold. Thank god it was only 2 nights. Will definitely return to Kings Inn across the road. Far superior. Oh and the hair dryer, which was badly cracked and caked with hair, that didn’t even dry your hair was a health and safety issue waiting.

DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS HOTEL! I REPEAT DO NOT BOOK! We booked thru their website for a very reasonable price. $100/night for one night in August. Well we get a phone call a month later saying that price is not right it is too low compared to other booking sites we can't charge you that price and have to cancel your reservation. Mind you they had sent us a confirmation when we booked on their website. The manager said she doesn't know the real price when i asked what will be the cost to stay then, she was clueless. Steer far away from this liars!

After nearly three weeks of moving every night along Route 66 we were super excited to be staying put at the Little Boy Blue for two nights. We took our car into the Disney park in the morning then came out for a mid-afternoon break to check-in. Check in and out was quick and easy. Location is fantastic and was the main selling point for us. We stopped at a delicious pizza place which I also fully recommend (Pizza Press) that also sells great beers on our very short walk back to Disney.  Room was clean, comfortable and very spacious.  For the value this was perfect for what we needed.  Thank you Little Boy Blue for a great stay!

My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights in October. Yes it was cheap, but after reading reviews felt like it was worth trying it out. We got there, and after settling in, tried the wifi to let our loved ones know we arrived safe and sound. It didn't work. After calling down about 5 times to the front desk, and an hour later it worked.   We went to bed, and I had the worst sleep ever. I could hear everything going on outside. The walls // windows // doors were paper thin and the traffic kept me awake. People walking to their rooms outside on the "hallway" felt like they were right in our rooms.   The breakfast is not a breakfast. Just some pieces of bread, a toaster, and some small pastries. Better off going to the Starbucks 2 minutes down the road.   Overall, fine if you want

We liked this place overall. It was a great place to stay for the price and proximity to the DLR/DCA Main Gates.  The woman working the Front Desk was super sweet and very quick with our check-in and check-out.   We didn't have any issues with the hotel itself. The room was clean, the bed was comfy, the shower worked. There's not a lot more we require from a hotel room.  There was an issue with a couple arguing in the parking lot of another hotel (shared parking lot) that woke us up, but we can't hold that against Little Boy Blue. Obviously it was nothing they have any control over.  I never heard any of our neighbors in adjacent rooms making any noise, but I could hear their showers. There were also some pretty loud cars/motorcycles that drove down Katella (modified exhausts)

Well I’d read the reviews for here some good some bad but I loved it. It’s a motel you get a room. Well this room was spacious clean and had everything we needed. We had a lovely clean bathroom the crisp white towels were changed daily n our beds made. The brekky were very simple as expected the toast were yum wish I had some now lol. The pool was small but clean an adequate as we were sightseeing most of our time. :) scentpotjen

This motel was pretty good, given its price and proximity to Disneyland. Nothing special, (by any means) but it had everything we needed, so I can't complain! Staff was nice and free parking/wifi was definitely handy. About a 20 min walk to Disneyland, and close to restaurants and small stores (CVS/Walgreens). Not bad!

Spent 3 nights here and found the motel to be clean comfortable and spacious plus the location is only 10 minutes walk to Disneyland and less than 5 minutes to Harbor Boulevard to catch the buses if you haven't got a car.  The breakfast is just toast, jam, pastries, coffee and orange juice which is basic but OK.  The staff were nice and when I checked out let me leave my bags while I killed time shopping as my flight was in the evening.  I have read complaints about the place but people forget thus is a budget motel and a nice one at that. If you want perfection go pay double or triple the price elsewhere.

Room is updated and clean. Bed is very comfortable with nice sheets. Includes a microwave and refrigerator BUT NO coffee pot. Also advertises continental breakfast but literally a few pieces of bread for toast, a couple packaged danishes, orange juice, coffee and decaf tea. A family of 4 would deplete the entire stock. I'm thinking they put very little out to cut down on wasting food. There is a Starbucks and a 7-11 within a half a block. 15 min walk to Disneyland entrance gate. I would stay here again but will bring a coffee pot with me.

Summary Heading: OK for a quick get away
Summary: Small hotel, clean, not fancy at all but the bed was comfy. Conveniently located by Disney and Gardenwalk. The shower was a bit small. Check in was easy. Never made it to the free breakfast. I definitely wouldn't stay here if I was needing a hotel for more than one night and/or had my kids with me.

Summary Heading: gets the job done at the right price
Summary: The hilton is down the street for 500 a night if thats what you're looking for. This isnt that. What it is is a decent motel room for a few nights you can do on the cheap. They have a nibble on the way out in the morning consisting of a danish or a piece of fruit and coffee. The room was clean. Had a microwave and a fridge too. Premium cable. The wifi actually worked excellently. ,No complaints.

I stayed here for a visit to Disneyland which is walking distance away. First off check in is tiny and VERY HOT. The room is small and average with old room and dirty covers on the bed. The bathroom was dirty, dusty, and the shower moldy. At midnight a woman walking up and down talking loudly on the phone was outside our room and kept us up until we called the lobby asking for them to do something as we could not sleep, twenty minutes later nothing. The "free breakfast" was not a breakfast with cheap, gross packaged pastries and thats it. It is VERY expensive for the price and I WOULD NOT STAY HERE.

Summary Heading: Don't make a reservation at this motel!!!!!!
Summary: We had a confirmed 3 day reservation at this motel. When we arrived a few minutes after 6:00pm. We were rudely told something was wrong with our credit card. And our reservation was cancelled at 6:00 pm.  We called our credit card company and nothing was amiss and there had not been  a charge from this motel.  This motel had lied to us.  We tried to reason with the clerk, he was rude, abrupt, and just yelled at us.  I would not want anyone to have this experience or worry. We had to drive 80 miles to get another room for the first night our trip. Do not trust them!!!!!

Had a reservation made a day before it appeared we had gotten the last room  , drove almost 3 hours from San Diego to Anaheim when we got there we were told our room had been canceled , I was shocked .  I understand we got there past 6 but somebody should have called to at least to notify us, pretty sure they did it to rent it out for more money which is ok it's all about greed. Never been in that type of situation before, but thankfully we found a room not far from Disney, Days inn has never failed us don't know why I didn't go there first , room was cheaper and from the looks of the other hotel Im sure we got the better deal.  Thank you Days inn

Great area. Room very basic to serve my purpose. Saw one cockroach on my 3 day stay. No bathtub in  my room. Shower curtain was dirty. Wouldn't take my girlfriend here or family but served my purpose. Staff friendly.

This hotel is older but we had a great time. You can walk to Disneyland in 10/15 minutes or take the shuttle. The staff was very nice and kept our rooms stocked with towels. The continental breakfast was a plus.

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL- BAD MANAGEMENT-MEAN PERSONAL
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for one nite. It was a miserable experience. The room had hair in the bathroom, shower head not working, thin towels, very noisy place, no wi-fi,and the breakfast.omg is all i can say about that is I would not feed the food(?) to my cat. Much better places with sweeter management that you can stay at. This is typical behavior in delhi,not in anaheim.

Nice big room, very clean,Very good pool, friendly staff, free wi-fi. Motel is close to Disneyland  shops and restaurants, as well as many places of interest .Really wanted to come here again and again...

Summary Heading: 3 BLOCKS FROM DISNEY- iNDIA QUALITY ROOM
Summary: TERRIBLE PLACE. Only thing going for it is proximity to disney.  Their breakfast is only from 730 to 9. It is sugary processed plastic bagged crab.  Will only give you 2 towels for 4 people.  Must ask for more. Will take hours to get more pillows.  Go to the Islander next door. or Motel 8 across the street.  Ice machine doesn't work. Lots of street noise and huge gap under front door won't block the noise.  Amount for this establishment was far less on some sites.  If you try to cancel, even if full, you will pay a $100 penalty.  Cheap owners with indian style standards (poor!!) Turned on shower and water went in every direction but down.  Faucet moved around when tried to turn on or off.  Wifi did not work.  We were extremely unhappy with this hotel.

We stayed a couple of nights, everything was basically across the street(walking distance) from food to Disney. Rooms do need minor repairs and could be cleaner for being a very small complex but we took our own covers/pillows and room has nice size TV. Other than room size(small/crowded) and easy minor fixes, we would stay again simply because we've stayed in expensive rooms and didn't notice much difference. Disney is a 15min walk and Bubba Gump along with many other big named restaurants are across the street(literally), so we never had to move our vehicle from motel. Everything is conveniently close, price is good but don't expect the Hilton maybe motel 6, it's great if you're not spending tons of time in room. Too much money spent at Disney to rent a $200 room you're not

About a 15 min walk to Disneyland front entrance which isn't all that bad. The staff were really not into it and I'm pretty sure I got bed bugs. The rooms were fine for what they were but overpriced for the quality. Wouldn't stay here again, that's for sure

Much older motel. Very small. You can tell they have put some work into the rooms. The beds were very comfortable. Large tv. The breakfast was very minimal. A bit of a walk to the park. I would stay again if I was pinching pennies.

This motel is great if your just spending a couple of nights and most of your time at Disneyland. Its clean and pretty comfortable. You can catch a bus that takes you right to the park. If you are looking for something luxurious I recommend one of the actual Disney hotels in the area. The little boy blue has a very small pool but it's a pool none the less.

The hotel itself is cute. A little older and needs an update and needs new pillows.... but had an unforgettable experience here, and not in a good way. We checked in very early around 12pm and the very young girl working the front said the room was not ready yet but you are registered and had the key cards to our rooms so when you come back tonight after Disneyland it will be ready. We get back to the hotel at around midnight, dog tired.. get up to the room and I open the door to find people sleeping and occupying our room! THEY DOUBLE BOOKED THE ROOM! It was scary and super embarrassing. we go back down to the night window and it takes them forever to get there.... we said someone was in the room they registered to us and the lady said nothing, not an apology or even a sincere

Summary Heading: Don't let the outside fool you. Or the quaint name
Summary: My family of 4 ( 2 teens) stayed just as a stop over place, this is a great little motel, when we first pulled in we were not sure about what we had reserved, but we were pleasantly surprised by our room. Big room, nice size bathroom, fresh paint, comfortable beds, large TV, refrigerator, microwave, nicely tiled bath, small but clean pool, what else do you need? Plenty of clean towels and our beds smelled like fresh clean linen our room was very clean. The front desk people were friendly and very sweet. Wish we stayed longer than just over night. They serve coffee and pastries in the AM also. Will definitely keep this in mind for future trips, Oh and right across from Garden Walk, close to convention center and Disneyland. Parking is tight but tell me where there is great

Summary Heading: Perfect and cheap to go to Wondercon
Summary: It doesn't pretend to be anything else than a cheap motel, but for that price you got good size room, comfortable beds, fridge, microwave, tv, wi-fi, tub, parking and the people are very kind. The motel is very close to the convention center and walking distance from Disney. Perfect!

This was a great place to stay.  You may hear people complain about the breakfast, but when you consider the price compared to others, what do you expect.  They do have a small fridge and microwave in each room, so we ran to the store and bought some milk and cereal, yogurt, what ever you would like and had our own breakfast in the morning.  It was only a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. The beds were comfortable, and the free wi-fi was great. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. We would definitely stay at this motel again.

Summary Heading: U get what u pay for
Summary: For not staying in the room long it was perfect. There was some marks on the doors that could have been clean but overall the room was fine. The tv and channel selection was nice. I would recommend the top floor for nose reduction. For the cheap price so we could spend more at the park it was perfect. Definitely a budget last minute place.

On our way to the hotel, the taxi driver had warned us that it may be a strange motel as he hadn't ever heard of it before, however it was great! The location was excellent (short walk from Disney and across the road from great restaurants), the rooms were well equipped, breakfast was good and overall the whole experience was a lot better than we expected. The only issues I had is that although the rooms were clean, the bathroom window was slightly cracked and in general, it wasn't as clean as the rest of the room. Also the wi-fi didn't work on my phone at all during my stay but everyone else's devices were fine. The staff weren't mean but they weren't friendly either, however I would visit again and I'd recommend this to families looking for affordable, comfortable accomodation

Maybe I shouldn't review this place since I haven't actually stayed here. On the way to the motel that afternoon I was rear-ended in a car accident and taken to the emergency room. Even though I was in the ER, I was decent enough to contact the motel and explained what had happened and that I obviously wouldn't be checking in that night. I asked if they would waive their $56  cancellation fee due to the extraordinary circumstances. The motel manager, Mr. Patel, refused to do so. He didn't even tell me he was sorry to hear of the accident and to get well. What a mensch! Anyway, if the motel management is this greedy and thoughtless, I hate to think how they treat their guests!

Summary Heading: Unclean rooms and extremely unhelpful staff
Summary: We stayed at this motel and were absolutely disgusted by what came home with us. Everyone in the group ended up with Scabies (a form of bed mite that burrows in the skin). The room appeared as though the linens were not changed even though the bed was made. Along with the disgusting fact that we got Scabies, the service was horrible! We arrived late in the evening and had to wait in the lobby for 20 minutes for a clerk to check us in. We would never stay here again or recommend this motel to anyone

Room was comfortable, and clean. Kids loved the pool. Staff was friendly and super helpful with maps and Disney tips. Location is 2 blocks from Disney front entrance. Allow parking in their lot for $10 a day after check out if you want to visit Disney (cheaper and more convenient than Disney parking garage). Breakfast was simple but handy. The staff is really working hard to make the motel a nice, safe, clean place for travelers. The motel is old, but the rooms are updated and the beds were clean and comfortable. Best price around for lodging near Disneyland.

Very small motel, I think it was one of the original Disneyland motels. It was a cheap price (about half of the surrounding hotels) and an awesome location, a block from the convention center and Disneyland. Lots of food places and excitement in the surrounding area. Our room was small but had two queen beds, a flat screen TV, fridge, microwave and a nice bathroom. I was impressed for the price! Also you can go out near the lobby and see a GREAT view of the Disney fireworks every night!

Summary Heading: Helpful friendly owners, right next door to Disneyland!!
Summary: Stayed here for three nights when going to Disneyland  This motel is 10 minuet walk at most from the park It's also up the road from take away and convenience stores   Staff were helpful and solved all out problems and any request wasn't a problem   Room was a little tired but over all great value for money, shower was ace  Only downside, they had no provided safes in the room

We stayed for one night and were very happy. The couple that runs the hotel were very pleasant and helpful. It is a bit of a walk from the park but we walked it in 15 minutes and there are busses you can take if you don't want to walk. The bathroom was clean, the carpets were newer, TV with lots of channels. Couldn't beat it for the price.  Yes they add 17% tax to the room rate but all hotels do that.  We were at the Marriott for a few nights and this hotel was $100 per night cheaper and well worth the move.  I will gladly stay here again. The outdoor pool was cold but it is winter and we came for Disney, not to swim.

Summary Heading: Thank God we were hardly in the room...
Summary: My sister and I stayed at this motel only out of necessity because of the price and because our go-to motel for Disneyland was booked up. When we arrived, the staff were rude. It was quite a walk from the park, which was the last thing we wanted after a jam-packed, 10+ hour day. The door to our room didn't close properly and it looked like everything was falling apart. After we checked out we asked to use a bathroom and the woman at the counter gave us a heavy sigh and grudgingly brought us into another room - no bathroom in the check-in area, I thought that was odd. The only good thing was that the water pressure was decent, the shower was hot, and the A/C worked. Will NOT be back again.

It's too bad that other people have had bad experiences at this motel. Here's the deal - DON'T stay here so that the availability will remain open for me! I stay at the Little Boy Blue at least 3 times a year. Other hotels have parking fees, blah, blah, blah. The other places may have some better amenities, but really? For visiting Disneyland, one just needs a relatively close proximity to the park (this is 12 -15 minutes walking distance), a good shower and nice beds for sleeping and napping. Plus, this is right across the street from the Ånaheim Garden Grove for lots of dining choices and shopping. Always ask for a refurbished room, because I'm not sure that all of the rooms have been refurbished (a work in progress) which might explain some of the bad reviews. I always ask

CONS:  1. It is not as cheap as it is advertised.  You get there and you have to pay an additional 17% tax on top of what you agreed to pay online already.  So there is really no savings choosing this over another hotel.    2. When we arrived late night.  My wife took the kid into the room and found a cockroach.     3. Everything is rusting away.  The bathroom door is in horrible shape.  The toilet has rust marks all over it.    4. I could barely fit in the tub and I am not a big guy.     5.Also the free breakfast they advertised, dont bother.  It is a complete joke.   They have bread and a toaster and some muffins in the check-in office area.    6. And yes very strong smell when you enter to check in.   PROS:  1. The room has nice size flat screen tv.    2. Also the wake-up

I was little bit scare after reading the comments from previous people but I got to say that it was the opposite of what I had read the owner Lisa is really nice  and she was really helpful, is not a fancy motel but is really clean  and the beds are really comfy also any time you need towels and you ask for it she never said no.

It's a pretty good walking distance to Disneyland and that's probably the only good thing about this hotel. The hotel looked pretty decent when I looked at on the internet but was the complete opposite from what I thought. The door was stuck and you had to push on it for a while just to get inside. It was hard to retrieve any free WiFi, and the only one that would appear on my laptop, was from the hotel next door. The room looked bare and had no sort of personality. There was also an odd smell to it when you walked in the room. Rather pay for hotel farther away from Disneyland, than stay here again.

Really if you are trying to save money and will bring all essentials - shampoo, conditioner, soap (stuff they have a bit scary) and blow dryer. They do have a new microwave & refidgerator. We did see a few bugs in bathroom at night but not during day. Beds sunk to center - pillows good though. TV new!  AC bit noisy. They do have a baby pool in back - we did not use but saw others use it. Maybe try upstairs room.

This motel is basic. Breakfast is basic - toast, muffins, oj, coffee Rooms are clean and new looking. the beds were comfortable and the air/heat worked. It is three blocks to Disneyland entrance. However, the all-year pool was closed. Worth the small price that we paid. We left at 8am and returned for lunch and then didn't come back until 10:30p, so for us the place was perfect.

The building maybe old but the furnishings were new: carpet, bed, pillows, TV and shelves. I thought it is a very good value by Anaheim standards.  It was $76.05 including tax for a weekend night, free parking.  The motel is also reasonably close to Disneyland. We had two toddlers in a stroller and walked 16 minutes from motel to DL's gates.   Though the breakfast was extremely basic, it was better than none. We got everything we paid for. No more, no less.

OK, so I kinda found this hotel by accident, since it's next door neighbor with whom I had a reservation could not accept my credit or debit cards through their machine and were only willing to accept "cash only" for the first night. Sadly, I got a room across the street at the Super 8, in a room that did not have a microwave or refrigerator.  The LIttle Boy Blue had newly remodeled rooms that were perfect and had a microwave and refrigerator. It was only $60 a night and had all the amenities I needed. When at Disneyland, you only need a place to sleep and nap, anyway.  Pros:  Clean room.          Great shower          New fixtures, new carpeting          microwave          'fridge           big screen LCD TV with cable           A/C           400 yards from the FREE Disneyland

I stayed at this motel.  Everything was clean and new.  I got a great rate.  Service was nice.  I found out the new owners had renovated the property recently and I thought they did a great job.  I was shocked by the old pictures posted on Trip advisor. This motel is much better than before.  I would stay here again.  I didn't end up taking pictures of the property.  Trip advisor needs to update the photos of the new motel.

Summary Heading: SCAM ALERT!!!!!  Don't give them you credit card number
Summary: We booked a room through Priceline for this hotel, paid for by our credit card number.  When we got there, they said the reservation was not confirmed, although I had the confirmation number in my hand.  The "Manager", who appeared to be on drugs, said the only way we could get the room was to give her cash...not another credit card, debit card....only cash.  That seemed odd.....so we called Bookings.com, where our reservation was confirmed.  We were told that the charge for the room would be processed once we registered.  We told the manger on drugs this, but she still insisted on cash.  So we left, the next day they started charging the credit card for the room, even though they denied they could charge the card without our signatures.  This hotel has a long list of criminal

Yes it was a business trip to a convention and trade show however, being from Florida, I had to do Disneyland one day. Weather was great and I could walk to both the convention center and local restaurants. Disney was literally a 3 minute drive. Upon checking in was told hotel was under new management and that I was getting a newly remodeled room. Everything was clean and comfy and  I was able to walk right out my downstairs room to the pool. No issues with either the condition of the rooms or pool. For $60 a night in this area it is hard to find something safe and clean and most importantly quiet. I got all of that. The new owners run a tight ship and seem to have put a lot of money into this place. Even though it is nothing super fancy and a basic place to lay your head, I

Summary Heading: A great stay for the price
Summary: A friend and I spent a week in California in January 2012, with three nights at the Little Boy Blue.  We chose the hotel because I was attending an event at the Convention Center and it was very close, and it was a very inexpensive room.  (We were traveling very much on a budget so price was of the utmost importance.)  The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The continental breakfast was nothing to write home about, but it was nice to have the option to grab a danish and coffee before we headed out every day.  The location was perfect and the surroundings gorgeous.  The room itself was older and had patched areas on the wall where work had been done and the paint hadn't been fixed, but it was clean.  There was a refrigerator and microwave in the room, which was

Summary Heading: My stay at Little Boy Blue was very very brief.
Summary: Subject: Little Boy Blue Motel, Anaheim  I would like to let you know about the service and results of my stay at Little Boy Blue Motel. On March 31st, I arrived around 11:30-12:00. I went into the tiny lobby to be greated by the managers wife. I showed her my reservation papers and the total costs of the room of $420.00 for 9 nights. The lady began punching up numbers on a calculator after taking my bank card that I used, and told me my total will be $490.00.  I asked the lady what the additional $70 charge was for, and she stated that its a state tax of 15% and a hotel tax of 2%, total of 17%. I showed her that taxes have already been added to the price of the room, she stated again that they always charge an additional 17% on top of what the booking company charges. I wasnt

Our church group stayed here for the Religious Education convention.  I would recommend another hotel, even though it is conveniently located near Convention Center and Disneyland.  Not sure what our Director paid, but I'm sure for a few dollars more, we would all have been more comfortable.  Several times our room key would not open the door, I had to go to the office repeatedly for re-keying, until finally the card lock would not work anymore and the manager had to open our room with his metal key, so we were without a key.  Inside the rooms are spacious but in need of major updating -- our phone did not have a dial tone, our microwave did not work (manager said we could use his), the smoke alarm was not hooked up, only had the base, no battery or cover (major safety

Summary Heading: THIS IS NOT A TEST THIS IS THE REAL DEAL RUN AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!
Summary: Okay only reason why we stayed here was because of my Church had paid for the room. First we read all of the terrible reviews and were hoping that they weren't as bad as portrayed. So upon checking in and opening our door, all seemed okay at first. Bed was okay until you really looked at the sheets and pillow cases. They were old and had some holes smaller that a dime maybe not even the size of buttons, but you could tell they were washed. Pillow cases had marks and you could also tell these were washed yet used over and over as some marks were there no matter how many times they were washed. Bathrooms looked like they were right out of the late 60's early 70's. The baseboards in the bathrooms had water damage. Continental B-fast was a cup of juice or milk and a danish

DO NOT STAY HERE!! Its a no refund, pay up front motel.  I think that is due to the number of walk outs they would have.  The rooms stank, the air conditioning unit looked unsafe, and the shower curtains were actual curtains.  Granted the bathroom was clean.  The beds on the other hand were a complete other story.  The sheets looked like someone had slept in them for a year without washing.  They were thin, gray and disgusting - my friend's looked they hadn't been washed, and mine were either stained, or that thin in places you could see the mattress underneath.  I didn't dare get close enough to look just in case I caught something. :-s   The blanket and coverlet were no better. I ran right across the road and booked into another motel, only after 20 mins.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!
Summary: My mom and I stayed one night, when we were visiting Disneyland. We arrivede to Anaheim at 6 or 7 pm, and we had driven all the way from Vegas. We just wanted a couple of evening ours in Disneyland.  We checked our coupon heft and tried several hotels/motels like Ramada and Super8, but they could not offer a room!  We saw i think it was $35 or $40 for the Little blue boy! We went in and they had a room!  It was quite small and had a really bad smell! They said that they had just cleaned the carpet, so it was a little wet and stinkey..  We walked the 10-15 minutes and had a great time in Disney.  We got back and both the room and bathroom had an awfull smell... But we slept fine and left the next morning!  I would defenetly recommend this motel if your on a rally tight bidget and

Before finding out how to book cheap hotels through another website, we thought the best way to handle our Disneyland addiction while saving money was to go to a rundown motel since all we would be doing was sleeping there at night. Well boy was I wrong!! I didn't think that it could be that bad, but it was scary! The location to Disneyland is great but the location itself was super shady and creepy. When we came home at night, there were a lot of creepy looking people hanging outside of the parking lot of the property. Dimly lit parking lot so I was a tad scared and definitely would not get out of my car if my fiance were not there.   Room smelled old. Bed was stiff and pillows were very thing. The bathroom was clean but all of the decor was old.   Go somewhere else. It is time

Summary Heading: Cheap and easy but service is lacking
Summary: Hotel was good for what it was - somewhere to sleep. Room and bathroom were clean but the tv was terrible we only got 3 working stations. Location was great 5min from Disneyland and across the street from restaurants. The down side was the owners not overly customer service oriented it was like pulling teeth trying to get an extra pillow. Hotel is cheap no frills but it was fine for us

Summary Heading: You Do NOT Want This Motel, THE WORST EVER!
Summary: I have stayed in alot of motels in my life, but this is for sure the worst. When my wife and I arrived they didn't offer us two key cards for the room. When we arrived at the door we couldn't get in. We went back to the office and they reprogrammed the card and it worked now. We had to get our one card reprogrammed two other times during our 3 day/4 nights. When we finally were able to get into the room it smelt weird, like another reveiwer mentioned, maybe cheap perfume. I went up to the office to let them know the internet wasn't working but they just didn't care. I noticed the one smoke detector hanging off the wall by one wire (picture). I called the front desk and told the woman about this, she just said "OK". I also told here husband the next morning, he replied "OK". When

Too much to list, so I will just keep this short. I know this is an economy motel, but COME ON!  Weird smell in bathroom, like strong cheap perfume. Very rude and unprofessional male manager. Too much to list. Internet never worked. Key card had to be reprogrammed several times. Breakfast was a bad joke. The worst ever! I could hear all my neighbors talking, every word, no soundproofing. The pillows were the worst I have ever seen in my life! Saw employees looking into the cars.  Never Again! Very stressful staying here. The worst of the economy motels near D.L.

Summary Heading: The Worst Stay of OUR LIVES!!!
Summary: My fiance and I took his sister and boyfriend to disneyland for valentines day.  It was supposed to be a romantic vacation with his sister boyfriend proposing to her at disneyland.  We had numerous men pounding at our door at 2 and 3 o'clock in the morning asking us if we were selling pot. Then realizing that it was the wrong room.  Our neighbors were drug dealers!!!!!!!!!!! needless to say the cops were called and the owner did nothing about it. DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO BUY SOME DRUGS!

Summary Heading: dirty smelly, small and not well kept
Summary: THe rooms were quite dirty and smelly and had not been kept up to well. The beds did not have fitted sheets which made it kind of awkward to sleep in. The price was pretty steep so when went to anaheim again we stayed at a better place right across the street for a better price.

We used this place as base to go to Disneyland, so we just used this place to sleep whist we were out all day on the rides. But this place was perfect for that job, it was clean, safe and cheap. It isn't a five star place, you do get what you pay for. It is only about ten minute walk to Disneyland. This place says it has a pool and it does, however it is in the carpark.  Breakfast can also get a little crowded, as it is served from a small desk in reception.  But if you're a couple on a budget or travelling and going to Disneyland, then this place is great.

Yes, this hotel was affordable.  I did not expect to be treated like a queen after what I had paid.  However, I did expect to be treated with respect.  I arrived a day before my family, since they were coming from Alaska.  They presummed that it would just be me in the room since I had checked in solo.  The first few days were OK, but things turned when my nephews grandparents came to take the family to Disneyland.  They wanted to park in the hotels lot, since my sister and I did not bring a car.  The owners refused.  Fine.  They parked in the Disneyland parking.  They next day the grandparents drove up to say goodbye to my nephew.  After saying goodbye they left.  We then went out front to wait for a cab.  The owner saw us and began to harrass my sister, asking what room was

Summary Heading: Very clean. Perfect for the Blizzcon and Disneyland!
Summary: We visited Anaheim for the Blizzcon 2009. This motel looks quite old from outside but the rooms were really great for the price. I love Bubba Gump Shrimps so I was very happy to discover that there is one just across the street. Rooms very clean and so the bathroom. I had to cancel one night  but that was no problem for the owners. There is a pool which we didn't  use and free Internet. Located only 10 minutes slow walk from the Anaheim Convention Center  (Blizzcon) and the Disneyland. Recommended!

Summary Heading: No Frills Lodging.  Tremendous Value.  Cozy & Tidy.
Summary: My job required me to take a class in Anaheim.  I researched online & chose Little Boy Blue  since it was cheap & close to the class location. $115 out the door for 2 nights.  Checked in around 9 pm.  Managers were cordial enough.  As I entered my room, I had to put a shoulder into the door because it was sticking to the door jamb. (New paint?).  Also, the inside deadbolt didn't work.  Okaaayyy?  I was met with a tightly spread CalKing bed, large desk, 6 drawer bureau with a 25" CRT color TV on a swivel stand, 2 end tables, mini-fridge w/microwave on top, cocktail table and an office chair (soiled.  The comforter on the bed was a tad thin for my liking, but the nice but loud wall AC/Heater would help make up for it.  No iron, coffee maker or bathroom heater.  Also, no drinking

I have stayed at Little Boy Blue many times in the last 2 years with no real problems except little things. This trip was nothing BUT problems. I booked the trip on a site that gave me the total of $145 after taxes and fees. When I arrived they charged me $165. I tried to explain to the manager that she was in the wrong but she barely spoke English and said that I was the one who was confused. Since I didn't have a print out of my statement I had no way to prove my price. I will return with a print out and fight it. The room was clean except for the bathroom, The shampoo and lotion bottles were both pre-opened with the safety sticker reapplied and the shower had 4 or 5 looong black hairs in the shower. GROSS!! On the last day of our stay there was construction on the street

For the price, the motel is great. Our room was clean, updated, and I thought was worth more than the $50/night. I stuck my head in another room that wasn't nearly as nice, however. I think I lucked out ;) The front  desk service was all right, they weren't very hospitable but they got the job done. As well, don't depend on the complmentary breakfast of white bread and greasy packaged donuts. The location is amazing, with many bus stops and even one close by that takes you to downtown LA. Loved it! Possibly staying there again this year, if I don't have a friend to stay with.

Summary Heading: Great Place for the Budget Traveler
Summary: If price and value is your overwhelming top proirity in searching for a place to stay then Little Boy Blue Motel is the place for you. Booking a room for the single traveler at rates almost twice as low as the next best available choice clinch the deal for us. Travelling to Disneyland in the summer holiday period from a budget traveler standpoint wasn't really a good idea in restropect, however if you just need a clean, cozy place to sleep and shower in, it fulfills all the requirements. True, the service isn't really 5star standard but it brings back nostalgia for me who stayed in motel back in the 80's. Its close proximity to Disneyland and the newly opened Anaheim Gardenwalk Shopping Mall is great for people who dont have a car. I would highly recommend Little Boy Blue for

Summary Heading: Great place for a budget trip if you just need a place to sleep.
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed for two weeks. We had driven straight there from Canada, no stopping and had arrived a few hours before check-in time, but they quickly accomodated us.  The receptionist was friendly enough, even if he does not have the clearest English ever. We figured our room was awesome for the price we got it at, with two good sized beds, a tv with good channels, a small fridge and microwave and a clean bathroom.  The wireless internet worked awesome too.  Across the street from the motel is a new mall, with a movie theatre, shopping and restaurants which is a great way to spend a night to go see a movie or something else.  The motel is less than 10 minutes walking distance from the entrance to Disneyland.  The pool was also a pretty decently kept pool, and though

It's not the fanciest place to stay at but it was cozy, clean AFFORDABLE and we though the management were very nice. For a vacation with a budget, it really does the trick. Plus it's really just a place to sleep in since we explored the city during the day. I would recomment it.

Summary Heading: Fine room but charged more than agreed
Summary: It was within walking distance of disneyland and had all the amenities that were promised, although the television only had several channels. The room was clean and big enough for 4 adults. I booked the room through travelocity and the price was $57 for one night. When we checked in, however, I was charged $62. The clerk claimed the extra charge was for "taxes," and we were charged the higher rate even though we presented the travelocity confirmation.

Summary Heading: Didn't Even Have to Look at the Room
Summary: I knew going in that this was a low low grade motel...I read the reviews prior to booking and focused on the positive reviews...the negative were right on target. The receptionist is rude. Knowing English well, you can't understand her, and she isn't a very good business person. The entrance to the hotel in old and nappy...the pictures online give it more of an "open" and roomy feeling. I beg to differ... it's cramped.   We pulled in off the main drag to the motel, it is a motel, which in right next to California Adventure (Yah!), so you can walk to the park easily. Regardless, from the moment we pulled in, I thought, "No way, I don't even have to see the room. We're not staying here." I accepted that I would have to pay a cancellation fee or something, but the woman at the

Summary Heading: Overall rate of stay was OK...Except!
Summary: The hotel room was OK except it has no ventilation in the bathroom. You have to open up the window to ventilate the room. Excessive amount of mildew in the bathroom. I have to pick a gallon of bleach just to clean the rim of the bathroom. And last this is, it has only one chair for the table.  With all the above problems, overall it was a quite and great stay!

Loved it!! Loved the  spacious room... the 2 beds... the bathrooms, and the microwave and fridge and TV!! Amazing location... turn the street ... you're in Disneyland!!  The room service was amazing.... the woman was very friendly and good at her job... I tipped her every morning!  And about the attitiude of the receptionist... I don't think he means to come off as rude... but he just has a very coarse tone.... he was nice to me... in a loud voice.... ahahahaaa! Also, if you can't understand what he said... he'll scream the sentence again! So... don't get too offended... I think he should be taken away and be told about how to have a friendlier tone. but not fired as some people have suggested.... it seems strange that he is at reception... I kind of guessed that he might've

Summary Heading: nice little place for someone on a budget
Summary: I'm a single Dad w/kids. My 11 yr old daughter found this place on the internet. It was close to D-Land Park, and was also very cheap. She was so excited about finding the "best deal", we just had to give it a try. I just prayed it would be clean. I liked it - room was small, but clean. Pool was also small, but clean. Room had a TV, Fridge, and microwave. Location was key - we walked to the park, dining and shopping were everywhere around us. It was perfect for us. We spend 99% of our awake time out and about, not in the room. We just need a clean, nice place to crash. Staff was friendly and cooperative. We took the $ we saved by getting a cheaper place and spent more at the Park. I think the people ripping on it here were expecting the Marriot for $50 a night.--LOL --Make up

We arrived at the motel at 4 o'clock in the morning, the manager was very rude, I guess because we woke him up, he will ask for your credit card and it will be charged for all the nights you have reserved, so if you don't like the room, it's too late to back out.  If you come in early like we did, you have to stand outside to check in, because their lobby is locked.  We stayed in room 119 not renovated we had double beds, not queen they use flat sheets, so when you turn your bed down, it all comes untucked and by morning it's a complete mess. Bath tub does not hold water, so bring your own plug, towels are ruff, noticed however the renovated rooms got new fluffy towels.  You get one wash cloth a day, the soap makes your skin feel tight, so if you don't like that feeling, bring

Oh gee, where to start…. It is true that this hotel has decent prices, which was the determining factor in booking the room for our vacation.  And it is true that this hotel has a luxury suite above the office which has been completely remodeled.  But….we were told by management that they save that room for “important VIP’s and business people” and not for the general public.  Our room was one of the worst, I believe.  I understand that with lower rates you do not expect high quality accommodations, but even decent customer service should be expected.  The manager (never did get his name) was rude from the first time that I called to verify our online reservations, and once we were at the hotel, the rudeness just became more apparent.  We were billed for the room upon check-in,

My boyfriend and I were looking for a cheap hotel to stay in Anaheim while we visited Disneyland.  We found little boy blue, and it was really cheap - something like $60US a night.    It is nothing fancy, but definately does the trick.  The room was clean and nicely decorated - but the carpet was filthy and really needs to be replaced.  It is an easy 10 minute or less walk to Disneyland, which was perfect.    Highly recommend this place if you are just looking for a cheap but decent place to sleep.

Summary Heading: Gave it a chance and was disapointed :(
Summary: Our experience at the Little Boy Blue was less that satisfactory.  Firstly,  we booked this hotel online,  mainly because of it’s price.   At something like $66 a night,  we were obviously not expecting some fancy place,  but ,  with the condition of the rooms at Little Boy Blue,  we now feel like they should have paid US to stay there.   I have backpacked all over Europe,  and stayed at some cheap hostels that had better conditions than this.   The location is pretty great if you are going to Disneyland,   about a 10 minute walk.  There are little shops,  like a 7/11 and a few restaurants nearby.     The first room we were given was on the ground level and at first glance looked clean.   Most of the surfaces in the hotel looked freshly wiped down ( except for a little dust etc)

From the reviews, it seems like a nice little hotel.  Not true. Was promised queen bed, got two twins. Mold in bathroom around toilet and shower. Beds were lumpy, room was small.  Windows are new, but they won't lock. (repeat - window in our room didn't lock) and as I walked by other rooms with the same style windows, it looks as if anyone could just open *any* window, looks locked, but the windows are too small for the opening.  Felt very unsecure/not safe.  Looks as if the renovations that people mention were not done well.  A coat of paint is not a renovation.  If you expect security and clean room - so somewhere else. (Even across the street - where we eventually stayed) was just a little more but well worth it - but so much more roomy, safe and clean.  For this area we just
Manager Response: Hello:   I read your review on tripadvisor.com and am sorry you had a disappointing experience.  However, as per your comments about the queen beds being "twins" - that is incorrect.  All of rooms have two queen beds.  Also, our rooms have always been known to be clean, including the bathrooms.  If you felt this was not the case, you could have brought it up to the onsite property managers who could have assisted in getting you another room and have had the room properly cleaned.  Thanks.

Summary: After viewing the internet and reviewing a number of motels, Little Boy Blue Motel had the best rating for its location (near Disneyland), cleaniness and price.     We booked 2 Queens Rooms from 12/23/2008 to 12/29/2008  making the motel our base for our visits to the various theme parks - Disney, Californian, Knotts Berry, Universal, SeaWorld.  No regrets in choosing Little Boy Blue as the rooms were clean, large size white towels and most importantly the rooms were being serviced daily.   The Continental Breakfast served were very basic - Plain or toasted bread with butter and jam, crossaints, tea/coffee.  It perfectly suit our daily needs before embarking on our visits to the Theme parks.   Overall, I give a 8 over 10 ratings for  their good housekeeping and managment of this

Summary Heading: Alot better than i had expected
Summary: Wasnt sure what to expect from this place. Booked it beacuse it was reasonably cheap and close to the Disney parks. On arrival its just a small office on the front, with the rooms behind, off the street. It has been recently refurbished and the rooms are clean, comfortable and well proportioned. The decor is interesting, walls are a sort of green colour, but that doest really matter to me i guess. They have the quickest internet connection i have ever experienced in a hotel up to now. truly amazingly quick. There is a pool. Its only a short walk to the Theme Park gates, give yourself about 15 minutes i guess. On the other side of the street is Anaheim Garden Walk which has shops and about 30 or so restaurants and a cinema. Very good selection of everything.

Reading the previous reviews I was uncertain so out of necessity we only stayed 2 nights.  (We had spent 3 nights at the RCI 'resort' hotel down the street but they did not have room our last 2 nights.)  All in all I preferred the Little Boy Blue.    It is one of the few remaining 1950 - 60s 'mom & pop' hotels which used to dominate the area.  (Most were torn down to make room for Calif. Adventure.)  Staying there brought back memories of when my parents took me to Disneyland.  It allowed me to pass on some historical and cultural information to my college-age son.  Attractive and recently re-furbished rooms were clean and opened onto the parking lot.  Unlike the new hotels, there was adequate parking.    My son and his friends stayed out much later than I did so, for the price

Summary Heading: Little Boy Blue review by real person
Summary: The motel more than exceeded our expectations.  My family spent four nights at the Little Boy Blue and since we were out most of the time and just needed a room to sleep in, this was perfect.  The rooms have recently been renovated, the queen size beds (2) are exactly that, queen size.  The restroom was nice with plenty of plush towels.  Oh, the location is what really helps.  You can walk to Disneyland but if we took the ARTS (shuttle) since we spent all day at disneyland and didn't want to walk.  The ARTS is almost right outside the motel and drops you off at the front of the park, very convenient.  It's also close to I-5 as we went to Knotts and Universal, so very close to the freeway.  The room had a working tv but we didn't have time.  If you're looking for a nice, quiet,

This motel review is mostly positive because it met most of my (albeit simple) travel needs. As others say, the location is great (a mile from Angels Stadium, it abuts a Disneyland parking lot etc.). There are a ton of restaurants, shops, small markets etc. within walking distance and, no kidding, there must be 20 places that deliver to the motel. The room has a big fridge and a microwave, along with some vending and an ice machine, to make in-room eating simple/affordable. The room was quiet and, partially due to the white noise of the AC, I slept like a baby. The owners, a family, are just the nicest people. There are complimentary pastries/doughnuts and juice in the morning, and there is a toaster in the office for use as well. My room was large, with plenty of space and two

We were looking for basic accomadations when travelling with our family to Disneyland. We searched online and found rates for this motel. Warning!! website pictures are very out of date.   Having said that when we called we were guaranteed that the motel was better than other reivews by the owners as they had just taken over last fall and were renovating. When we arrived....they were correct and renovating rooms. However we had booked two rooms.....one had been renovated and the other had not. Make sure if you book you are in a renovated room.   They also said they provided a continental breakfast.....this was not as one would expect. You got a basic sugar fix consisiting of hostess twinkies, animal crackers, and packaged cookies. There was no such thing as fruit, toast and

I was searching for an inexpensive place for 5 nights. I found this place on a website. I am surprised by the friendliness of the staff (family). The room was decently clean. It has a mini fridge and a microwave. The TV has basic channels. They also have wireless internet. It is not Hilton, but you get good value for what you pay. If I come back to Anaheim and search for an inexpensive stay, this is one of the places I would look first.

Summary Heading: A good deal and close to Disney
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights.  We utilized 5 rooms for everyone in our group.  Two of the rooms were completely renovated, the other three still needed work done in the bathrooms.  All rooms had newer paint, beds, furniture etc.  A couple of the rooms also need new Air Conditioning units as they were old and smelled a little when turned on - you get used to it after a few minutes - not repulsive but noticeable.  The previous reviews had us nervous but upon arrival we noticed the management was friendly and had made great efforts to improve from the previous ones.  The only thing wrong with the room I stayed in was the need for new carpet or a good steam cleaning.  You could tell they had cheap carpet as it stained easily and had some black spots - it probably has a couple

Okay, sure, it is not the nicest looking motel.  But for the price, it is clean.  We stay there almost every time we go to Disneyland because it is within walking Dineyland and is cheap.  The management is really helpful and there is a small breakfast provided in the morning.  If you don't care what the room looks like and want to save money, try it out.

When I read the previous reviews of this hotel I was very concerned. Once we checked in, I did a thorough check of the carpet, shower, toilet, fridge, and under the beds. New management has done an excellent job of turning it around. All of the linens were new as well as the furniture, fridge, and microwave. This hotel was under priced compared to what we received and the surrounding hotels and their prices. We will stay again.

My sister and I stayed at room 103 for three nights and find the place better than we expected. Though when we first entered the room it smelled a bit "old", this cleared after a while. It seems to be newly refurbished and painted and nothing like what the other reviews I’ve read (clean and new microwave, refrigerator, cable TV, bed linen and daily fresh towels). This is because of the recent efforts done by the new management to renovate the place. The manager is very helpful and accommodating and even helped us with our arrangements for airport pick-up. The breakfast is superb – coffee, apple juice or orange juice with croissant, toasted bread, mini donuts and cookies. The location is great, only 10-minute leisure walk from Disneyland. We’re definitely recommending the place!

DO NOT STAY HERE. This hotel was the worst I have ever stayed in. It was filthy and I chose to ignore my inner voice and didn't check out right away. In the morning I found dead bed bugs in the sheets! And then realized later I had been bitten all over my body...face, neck, hands, arms, legs...any part of my body that hadn't been clothed. This experience was DISGUSTING and very uncomfortable for several days. The worst part is that I recently realized I took stowaway bedbugs home and have had the whole house steam cleaned and exterminated. I honestly would have preferred sleeping in my car to my experience at the Little Boy Blue Motel.  I will say the people are very nice, but they need a higher standard of cleanliness before they can charge another person to sleep there.

I honestly don't know how others can rate this place more than 1 star.  I wanted to stay elsewhere so bad.  Unfortunately we paid the 3 nights stay already and had no refund if we didn't stay there.  We stayed in Room 115 upstairs.  The capart was full of  huge black spots.  The room smelled like crap.  There was no telephone or alarm clock in between the two beds.  Only 1 beside lamp (60w) for the entire room.  The telephone was on the opposite side of the room.  You have to get up to go over to answer the phone or wake up call.  The wallpaper was dirty.  Hairs and some potato chips crumbs on bed sheets.  The inside of the microwave looked even dirtier than your office one.  The bathroom was dirty.  Lots of moldings and stains on the ceilings.  Only one piece of shower curtain

Summary Heading: Rooms Smell of Smoke and Butt
Summary: This is absolutely the most disgusting place I have ever stayed, though I only was there for about an hour.   My girlfriend and I needed a place to stay; we had booked a room at the Anabella for two nights and had decided to stay in Anaheim a third, but were unable to get the same or a similar room.  We went here thinking that though they didn't look like much, they may not be so bad. We checked out FIVE rooms, and each was the same. In one room there were tampon boxes with USED tampons in them under the bathroom sink,  there was a discarded condom nestled in the sheets in another, the  beds were unmade, the were pamphlets and newspapers on the floors, clothes (including underwear) strewn over one bed, and I actually saw a rat in one of the rooms.   Despite all that, and my

This was a much nicer motel than I expected. I had read the review after booking with Hotwire and was very worried as to what I would find. I had 2 small children traveling with us. From the begannibg the gentleman at the front desk was very nice and informative. We found out that they had recently taken over the motel and believe my from the fright reviews they have done a marvelous job. The towels, carpet, and furniture all looked new. You could tell that it was an older motel but everything was clean and freshly painted, It was well worth the price and I would stay again.

My mother inlaw booked some time in advance. My wife and I looked up the reviews the day before we departed from Texas and were very sceptical about what to expect.   Upon arrival we noted that the motel is older but was well kept. The room was newly renuvated with new carpet, air conditioner and the paint was fresh. The room overall was quite satisfactory if not better than the price we paid.    As stated on the website, Disneyland is within walking distance.   The customer service was a-one! Very friendly and helpfull.   If afforded the opportunity we will return!

Weathered puke on the matress, "special" hairs in the sheets, mildew stains and vibrant brown footprints in the shower, and a wonderfully unpleasant odor - just some of the accomodations offered by the Little Boy Blue. Our TV even started smoking during the middle of the night - that's right, smoking. This place was disgusting. We were trying to travel cheap for our family vacation, but we never expected to end up at the Scarriot hotel. I would have rather stayed at the Bates Motel; at least the manager there knows how to use Bleach.

This hotel was (and still is) the butt of so many jokes!  It seemed to only get worse the longer we were there.  First, the pool is right in the middle of the parking lot, a little weird but not that big of a deal.  The odor when you walk in the room is terrible.  All of the furniture looked liek it had been bought at a yardsale, the chairs and beds were all unmatching.  The table thing between the beds was put on so crooked I didn't even feel comfortable putting a drink on it.  The bathroom was filthy and instead of curtians the window was PAINTED dark blue, etched into the paint was a large drawing of someone bending over....no I am not kidding about this.  Terrible and I do not recommend!!

I paid $80 per day for this crap and stayed for two days. It has all decades old stuff and not worth even $25 per day. It had a dirty bathroom, 1900 model TV, microwave, AC and Refrigerator ofcourse. The bedding is so bad and I didnt like sleeping in it, but didnt have any other option for those two days. I dont ever dream about staying in such a hotel again.

The room was filthy and the shower stall had mildew.  We checked in at Midnight and checked out at 12:30 am. I would not recommend this motel.  The price maybe great, but the picture that showed the motel is nothing like what we saw with our own eyes.  We found unknown items under the bed and blood stains on the sheets.  The furniture in the motel was very, very old.  Nothing was fashionable about this motel. My daughter was in tears and it started our vacation out with a very bad bang.  We were very fortunate to have found another motel, as they were having a convention of some sort going on that weekend.  We paid about sixty dollars more, but it was well worth it.

Plusses: Great price, best I could find Friendly and helpful staff Clean room Short walk to Disney main st (can even use free 'lion king' tram to save 1/2 the walk) Microwave and fridge in room 2 queen beds Nice looking pool (altho we didn't try it) free parking Minuses: Noticable odor when you first walk into room (wifey sprayed room deodorizer, seemed to help) No HBO or Showtime Soap bars are tiny (bring yer own) Free breakfast consists of coffee and a danish roll Ice is 25 cents Overall: The odor really only hits you when you first walk into the room, not noticable after 5 minutes. We'd just spent 5 nights at the Hilton, and the sheets, towels, and floors were about equally clean. Certainly nicer digs there, but OK here. Especially for the price. We'd stay there again.

Now I know what one star means. I didn't know it could be that bad. It all started with the horrible lady at the front desk. For that alone I would not reccomend it. Then there was the dirty bathroom and the general odor in the room.
